ai-mn131:4.1_0: And how do you run back to the past?
ai-mn131:4.2_0: You muster delight there, thinking: ‘I had such form in the past.’ ... ‘I had such feeling ... perception ... choice ... consciousness in the past.’
ai-mn131:4.3_0: That’s how you run back to the past.
ai-mn131:5.1_0: And how do you not run back to the past?
ai-mn131:5.2_0: You don’t muster delight there, thinking: ‘I had such form in the past.’ ... ‘I had such feeling ... perception ... choice ... consciousness in the past.’
ai-mn131:5.3_0: That’s how you don’t run back to the past.
ai-mn131:6.1_0: And how do you hope for the future?
ai-mn131:6.2_0: You muster delight there, thinking: ‘May I have such form in the future.’ ... ‘May I have such feeling ... perception ... choice ... consciousness in the future.’
ai-mn131:6.3_0: That’s how you hope for the future.
ai-mn131:7.1_0: And how do you not hope for the future?
ai-mn131:7.2_0: You muster delight there, thinking: ‘May I have such form in the future.’ ... ‘May I have such feeling ... perception ... choice ... consciousness in the future.’
ai-mn131:7.2_3: You muster delight there, thinking: ‘May I have such consciousness in the future.’ ...
ai-mn131:7.3_0: That’s how you don’t hope for the future.
ai-mn131:8.1_0: And how do you falter amid presently arisen phenomena?
ai-mn131:8.2_0: It’s when an uneducated ordinary person has not seen the noble ones, and is neither skilled nor trained in the teaching of the noble ones. They’ve not seen good persons, and are neither skilled nor trained in the teaching of the good persons.
ai-mn131:8.3_0: They regard form as self, self as having form, form in self, or self in form.
ai-mn131:8.7_0: consciousness as self, self as having consciousness, consciousness in self, or self in consciousness.
ai-mn131:8.8_0: That’s how you falter amid presently arisen phenomena.
ai-mn131:9.1_0: And how do you not falter amid presently arisen phenomena?
ai-mn131:9.2_0: It’s when an educated noble disciple has seen the noble ones, and is skilled and trained in the teaching of the noble ones. They’ve seen good persons, and are skilled and trained in the teaching of the good persons.
ai-mn131:9.3_0: They don’t regard form as self, self as having form, form in self, or self in form.
